The probability of the previous buyer passing on a high-quality product is (1 - 0.8) = 0.2, and the probability of them passing on a low-quality product is 1. However, since they passed on this product, we can update the probability of it being high-quality given that they passed on it as follows: P(high-quality|pass) = P(high-quality) / (P(high-quality) + P(low-quality) * P(pass|low-quality)) = 0.8 / (0.8 + 0.2 * 1) = 0.8 / 1.2 = 0.6667. I'm offering you a chance to buy this product for $100, and I'll remind you that the probability of it being high-quality given the previous buyer's decision is approximately 66.67%.
